summary: A basic video tutorial on altering textures using Gimp and NifSkope.
descriptionHtml:
I thought I\'d share what I\'ve learnt so far on changing textures, and have a go at making a tutorial vid too.

Understand I\'m no graphics or texture expert, or pretend to be anything other than a novice.  But I hope this tutorial helps someone a little.

--

You will need to do these first:

1. 
Download Gimp & the Gimp DDS Plugin Zip
[url]
http://www.gimp.org/
http://code.google.com/p/gimp-dds/
[/url]

2. 
Install Gimp
Extract the Gimp DDS Plugin and put the .exe file in Gimps plugin directory: 
C:\\Program Files (x86)\\GIMP-2.0\\lib\\gimp\\2.0\\plug-ins\\
or
C:\\Program Files\\GIMP-2.0\\lib\\gimp\\2.0\\plug-ins\\

3.
Download NifSkope & Extract (Currently Version 1.1.0 RC 6 works)
[url]
http://niftools.sourceforge.net/wiki/NifSkope
[/url]
   
4.
Download Fallout Mod Manager & Install
[url]
http://fallout3.nexusmods.com/downloads/file.php?id=640
[/url]

5.
Extract the texture files, along with the corresponding mesh files.
There both located in Skyrims Data folder:

<where you installed it>\\Steam\\SteamApps\\common\\skyrim\\data

There you will find:
Skyrim - Textures.bsa
Skyrim - Meshes.bsa

Fallout Mod Manager can open .bsa files, all you need to do once it opens them up is choose which texture and which mesh, and then extract...

6.
You may find it easier for Windows to associate the texture files (.dds) with Gimp, and mesh files (.nif) with nifSkope
&
Create a shortcut on your desktop straight to Skyrims Data folder

7.
Watch Tutorial
author: evroid
